report_title: Glucose Meter Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Over the past five years, the glucose meter manufacturing industry has benefited from the rising prevalence of diabetes. The American Diabetes Association (ADA) reports that there are about 8.5 million individuals with undiagnosed diabetes, providing manufacturers with a large potential customer base. Diabetic patients use glucose meters to manage their glucose levels, as these meters measure and display the amount of sugar (i.e., glucose) in their blood. Products have increasingly appealed to diabetic patients because meters now require less blood to take measurements and can store previous glucose levels, streamlining patients' healthcare data. However, over the past five years, revenue has slumped at a CAGR of 0.9% to $3.1 billion, including an expected 1.4% increase in 2023. Profit is expected to slump to 7.9% of revenue in 2023 from 10.8% in 2018.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years, new technologies have shaped the healthcare sector. This industry has introduced glucose meters that feature new technologies to assist end users in accessing their glucose levels.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Regulatory Framework Has Increased, Causing Unprofitable Manufacturers to Exit the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While manufacturers are considered exempt from the medical device excise tax, they are still subject to intense regulation. In particular, the FDA has tightened its requirements for meter accuracy by prohibiting equipment that provides outlier measurements from entering the market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The FDA has drastically changed its outlier requirements for glucose meters
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The FDA has drastically changed its outlier requirements for glucose meters used in hospital settings and other healthcare facilities to mandate that no individual test result can be more than 20.0% off the reference method.
According to the World Health Organization, over three-quarters of diabetic individuals live in low- to middle-income countries, demonstrating robust global demand for industry exports.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Uncertainty of Regulations May Limit Product Development and Price-Based Competition Will Limit Profit
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry revenue is expected to climb due to rising demand for glucose meters as diabetes is expected to become increasingly prevalent domestically and abroad.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Technology Will Spur Growth in Less Invasive Techniques to Measure Glucose
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Many glucose meter manufacturers have sought methods to create less invasive glucose meters.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Exports Are Set to Climb as the US Dollar Weakens and the Global Diabetic Population Expands
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The global diabetic population is expected to grow rapidly over the next five years.

industry_definition: The Glucose Meter Manufacturing industry develops and produces blood glucose meters and testing supplies that help users monitor blood glucose levels. Most manufacturers also develop other medical devices.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

key_trends: The visual showing "D 4,313 $ million" appears to be a graph or chart displaying domestic demand for the glucose meter manufacturing industry.
Over the next five years, industry revenue is expected to climb as diabetes becomes increasingly prevalent.
Some diabetic individuals have used continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems.
Unprofitable manufacturers have exited the industry, causing the number of industry enterprises to fall.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The individuals aged 40 to 54 market jumps due to individuals typically being tested for diabetes at the age of 45.
The individuals aged 55 to 64 market expands due to increased demand for glucose meters.
The individuals aged 65 and older market slumps as Medicare does not cover continuous glucose monitoring.
The individuals aged 39 and younger market jumps as a growing number in this market are diagnosed with diabetes.

products_and_services.product_description: The oral antidiabetic segment is the largest product segment and has remained stable. This segment makes up over one-third of total revenue.

products_and_services.product_or_service: CONTINUOUS GLUCOSE MONITORING (CGM) SYSTEMS AND METERS
products_and_services.product_description: The continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems and meters segment grew in popularity, causing this segment to expand.
The insulin delivery segment has remained relatively stable.

tier_1_suppliers: Plastic Pipe & Parts Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Electrical Equipment Manufacturing in the US
Scientific Research & Development in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The rising prevalence of diabetes, especially among younger individuals, is driving demand for glucose meters and related products.
Continuous advancements in glucose monitoring technology, such as real-time data transmission and improved accuracy, are increasing demand.
The aging population, which is more susceptible to developing diabetes, is boosting demand for glucose monitoring products.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Manufacturers have expanded to include international operations, boosting imports.
The strengthening of the US dollar has boosted industry imports, making them more affordable for domestic consumers.
Manufacturers must produce products that meet ISO and FDA standards to export to large diabetes markets like the Western Pacific and South East Asia.
Large export markets like Canada and Mexico benefit from favorable trade relations with the US through agreements like the USMCA.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region attracts manufacturers because of its significant population.
Manufacturers concentrate in the West due to the large population and major trading ports.
Manufacturers concentrate in the Great Lakes region due to its proximity to Canada and because it's a manufacturing center.
Manufacturers may locate near downstream markets, such as consumers and healthcare providers.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Quality System (QS) Regulations
regulations_points.regulation_description: Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) require domestic or foreign manufacturers to have a quality system for designing, manufacturing, packaging, labeling, storing, installing and servicing finished medical devices intended for commercial distribution in the United States.
Medical device reporting (MDR) regulation permits the FDA and manufacturers to identify and monitor adverse events involving medical devices.
Imports are subject to the same regulations as domestically produced goods.
Businesses were encouraged to maintain extra precautions for employees at higher risk for serious illness.

basis_points.basis_title: Manufacturers primarily compete on price and quality of products.
basis_points.basis_description: Competition based on price is crucial for manufacturers that develop products not covered by Medicare.

basis_points.basis_title: No direct substitute for glucose meters.
basis_points.basis_description: However, imports make up the external competition experienced by domestic manufacturers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: THE INDUSTRY HAS A MODERATE LEVEL OF MARKET SHARE CONCENTRATION
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is moderately concentrated as the top three companies account for over one-half of industry revenue in 2023.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs hike due to volatile input commodity prices
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are expected to account for 33.6% of revenue in 2023, up from 32.6% in 2018.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wage expenses jump as manufacturers invest in their research and development workforce
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are expected to account for 25.0% of revenue in 2023, up from 20.8% in 2018.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Miscellaneous costs are significant because of environmental law compliance
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Miscellaneous costs are expected to account for 29.2% of revenue in 2023, down from 31.5% in 2018.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Manufacturers invest significantly in their research and development workforce.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Demand for some products is susceptible to fluctuations
volatility_points.volatility_description: While diabetic patients consider glucose meters as medically necessary, demonstrating stable demand for products.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Industry revenue is subject to global economic conditions
volatility_points.volatility_description: While the medical necessity of products keeps revenue volatility relatively moderate, glucose meter manufacturers operate in a global market.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Low levels of innovation limit threat from new technologies
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Low levels of innovation limit the threat to incumbent operators from new technologies disrupting their operations.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: In response to rising competition, many companies within the industry have specialized in higher value-added products to justify higher selling prices.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Macroeconomic conditions, such as consumer confidence and disposable income, influence demand for industry products.
